1119268645132279811.text:
4a/ Then we move to use cases!

-@sonyaellenmann on finding product-market fit with crypto
-@hosseeb+@RoblehAli on stablecoins vs. Central Bank Digital Currency
-@charleymooreesq on legal smart contractspic.twitter.com/AGDvGZYBbE

1119268643345457152.text:
3/We'll cover "technical updates" in the 1st section of the main day event:

-@neha on Bitcoin and field building
-@danrobinson on smart contract scalability and interoperability
-Simon Whitehouse on permissioned chains
-@QuaintM on the technical tradeoffs in permissioned systemspic.twitter.com/CQRFIrtzqC

1119268652090626048.text:
7/ Then finish out the day with regulation+government+Wall St.

- @FCC's @JRosenworcel on mechanisms to allocate the wireless spectrum 
- @valkenburgh on parallels with the early internet
- @CaitlinLong_ on financial rehypothecation
- Gary Gensler on the macro regulatory scenepic.twitter.com/PBQAP9UhSP

1119268639822233600.text:
1/ Along with @techreview, we're hosting the Business of Blockchain conference on May 2nd! 

Please stop by if you're already in town for @blockchainwk (or come a bit early before NY Blockchain Week!).

Here's what the line-up looks like

1119268646877040640.text:
4b/ With some more use cases:

-@sbmckeon+@CadreRE's Alex Labowitz on the tradeoffs of security tokens
-@salesforce's Adam Caplan on macro enterprise use casespic.twitter.com/iPCBJx9CPo

1119256451464273920.text:
Our student co-ops presenting their work from this term! 

- @Rjected's DEX project (and how it compares to @arwensecure, @sparkswap, @0xProject, @Binance_DEX, @bitshares).

- Cole Vick's project on central bank digital fiat (and why we'd use it vs. ACH, FedWire, etc.).pic.twitter.com/jaOe5NQKi4

1119268640602370049.text: 2a/ To start, we have a sweet educational primer the night before. We're using @caseykcaruso's "5 Camps of Crypto" as a framework. (Thank you Casey!)https://medium.com/@caseycaruso/the-five-camps-of-crypto-1aa8695b76bc …

1119268657807482880.text: Hope to see you there! Thanks to everyone for speaking and thanks to @kelsiepallanck, @mike_orcutt and @RhysLindmark (i.e. me, the person who is writing this tweet ) for organizing!

1115383947683401728.text:
Cryptocurrency Research Review #3 is here (and longer!).

-@go_interstellar's @cathieyun gives an *awesome* overview of bulletproofs
-DCI's @RoblehAli analyzes the BIS report on central bank digital currency
-@UTAustin's @elwrv on a zk-system called Spicehttps://mitcryptocurrencyresearch.substack.com/p/mit-dcis-cryptocurrency-research-350 …

1119268641436991488.text:
2b/ Here's who's "representing" each camp (as an educational exercise):

Sound Money: @tdryja, @mitDCI 
Internet Payments: @StacieWaleyko, @CasaHODL 
Web3: @crypt0glitter, @levelk_io
#DeFi: Greg DiPrisco, @MakerDAO 
DLTs: @alex_pentland, @medialab's Connection Sciencepic.twitter.com/cWOasbNf6u

1119268648605114368.text: 5/ @PwC's @scottlikens takes us through lunch by discussing how crypto overlaps with IoT + AIpic.twitter.com/DDhBfqeJ5c

1119268650198937600.text:
6/ Post-lunch we zoom out to the global context:

- @AlibabaGroup's Hui Zhang on blockchain in China
- @sopnendu on how Singapore thinks about crypto
- @AlexisGauba on diversity and inclusion
- @mi_ayako on the values/ethics of the blockchain ecosystempic.twitter.com/pWR0G0gvUA
